unnormalised: Delhi HC grants interim injunction to Super Cassettes Industries Ltd. in copyright infringement case. The case, filed on 10/10/2024, alleges that a local company, 'Desi Tunes', was illegally distributing T-Series songs online. Justice Sharma issued the order after reviewing the evidence presented by Adv. Rajan, representing T-Series.
normalised: Delhi High Court grants interim injunction to Super Cassettes Industries Limited in copyright infringement case. The case, filed on tenth October two thousand and twenty four, alleges that a local company, 'Desi Tunes', was illegally distributing T-Series songs online. Justice Sharma issued the order after reviewing the evidence presented by Advocate Rajan, representing T-Series.

unnormalised: The court noted prima facie evidence of copyright violation, observing similarities in the uploaded content and T-Series' original tracks. Desi Tunes has been directed to immediately cease all infringing activities. The next hearing is scheduled for 15/11/2024 at 2:30 PM.
normalised: The court noted prima facie evidence of copyright violation, observing similarities in the uploaded content and T-Series' original tracks. Desi Tunes has been directed to immediately cease all infringing activities. The next hearing is scheduled for fifteenth November two thousand and twenty four at two thirty P M.

unnormalised: This isn't the first IP law case for Super Cassettes. They previously won a similar case back in '22. The current lawsuit highlights the ongoing challenges faced by the Indian music industry in protecting its intellectual property in the digital age. The injunction is a win for T-Series, but the fight against online piracy continues.
normalised: This isn't the first I P law case for Super Cassettes. They previously won a similar case back in two thousand and twenty two. The current lawsuit highlights the ongoing challenges faced by the Indian music industry in protecting its intellectual property in the digital age. The injunction is a win for T-Series, but the fight against online piracy continues.
